edu.wpi.cs.jburge.SEURAT.rationaleData
Class RationaleDBUtil

java.lang.Object
  edu.wpi.cs.jburge.SEURAT.rationaleData.RationaleDBUtil

public class RationaleDBUtil
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains some very important utility methods for ensuring that SQL table names and statements are properly formatted depending on the database type currently in use, and thus ensuring the proper behavior of SEURAT's database queries and statements. It also holds the utility methods for exporting and importing the argument ontology to and from XML.

Nested Class Summary
static class RationaleDBUtil.DBTypes
          Enumeration consisting of the different database types that SEURAT uses.

public static java.lang.String escape(java.lang.String txt)
The user can type all sorts of stuff into a text box that will make the database unhappy. Put escape characters in where needed

Parameters:
txt - - the text to be encoded prior to saving
Returns:
the text with escape characters added

public static boolean exportToXML(java.lang.String xmlFile)
This method handles the exporting of a database to XML. Currently the method only exports the pattern library and the ontology.

Parameters:

Returns:

exportArgumentOntology

public static boolean exportArgumentOntology(java.lang.String ontFile)
This method handles the exporting of a database's argument ontology to XML. The file to export to is hardcoded in the RationaleDB class but could be moved to the preference page in the future, which is why this method takes it as a parameter.

Parameters:
ontFile - - the filename to import the XML ontology from
Returns:
boolean indicating whether or not the export was successful

importFromXML

public static boolean importFromXML(java.lang.String xmlFile)
This is the method to import XML. Currently, we're only importing the ontology and the patternLibrary. But this can be easily changed here...

Parameters:
xmlFile -
Returns:
true if import is successful, false otherwise.

importArgumentOntology

public static boolean importArgumentOntology(java.lang.String ontFile)
Deprecated. This method is no longer in use. We should use importFromXML(String) method.

This method handles the importing of an argument ontology from XML. The file to import from is hardcoded in the RationaleDB class but could be moved to the preference page in the future, which is why this method takes it as a parameter.

Parameters:
ontFile - - the filename to import the XML ontology from
Returns:
boolean indicating success or failure
